function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Covid-related collapse of the international cashew market leading to food insecurity for farmers working in the Cantanhez National Park.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Recognizing trade-offs in conservation research agendas due to reduced future spending and accelerating climate and biodiversity crises.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Understanding human-nature interactions, including inter-species disease transmission pathways, and changes in motivations for seeking interactions with nature due to the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Zoonotic disease outbreaks including COVID-19.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large-scale engineering projects.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Sudden economic or political change.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through wildlife and the environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of zoonotic disease spillover due to perturbations in wildlife and ecology.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential impact of conservation activities perturbation on disease vectors and transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of COVID-19 pandemic on biodiversity conservation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interconnectedness of all things leading to spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerabilities in social and economic models for conservation activities due to pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resumption of funding to pre-pandemic levels cannot be guaranteed due to global financial downturns.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rushed government measures or societal backlash may harm conservation efforts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biodiversity changes associated with global human confinement and pandemic-related societal and behavioral changes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decline in tourism revenue and disrupted trade routes leading to economic losses, poverty, and resource use.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Consequences of declines in tourism and trade resulting from COVID-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in conservation monitoring and enforcement capacity due to restricted movements and postponed funding.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of inter-species transmission of contagious diseases in the Cantanhez National Park due to proximity between wildlife and humans.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced presence of international researchers leading to a potential lack of expertise and knowledge in conservation and wildlife management.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential economic impact on tourism-dependent economies like the Seychelles due to reduced tourism activity.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate messaging about the impact of COVID-19 on conservation efforts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on large visitor numbers for funding sustainable tourism.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of new technologies and techniques for public engagement, tourism, and research.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Opportunity for renewed emphasis on in-country partnerships and collaboration due to the pandemic.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Withdrawal of researchers and practitioners from conservation sites due to travel restrictions, leading to the cancellation or postponement of research.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clear long-term vision affecting the continuity of conservation action and messaging post-pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inter-species disease transmission and risk within Cantanhez National Park.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of cancelled field trips, meetings, and networking opportunities on conservation biases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of in-person engagement mechanisms leading to decline in community trust and participation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of disease transmission leading to extermination of local populations of species.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in monitoring data due to closures and social distancing restrictions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduced funding and income for conservation activities and local communities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Biodiversity conservation deprioritized post-pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impacts of delayed projects and funding cuts.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for holistic approaches to address zoonotic transmission and biodiversity loss.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Withdrawal of conservation funding due to conflict or social-political shifts.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on tourism and visitor revenue for financing conservation activities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Chronic underfunding of conservation programs and protected areas.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduced capacity and increased costs of implementing safety procedures may lead to inadequate conservation activities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Less urgent tasks such as research projects and long-term monitoring are deprioritized during the pandemic, leading to gaps in data and understanding of conservation needs.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilization of militarized conservation methods post-pandemic may have severe societal and psychological repercussions, particularly for communities previously traumatized by war.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Loss of income from tourism impacting biodiversity and increasing reliance on natural resources.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction of incentives to conserve wildlife and habitats central to tourism-based industries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Danger and difficulty of accessing areas in warfare and disaster zones.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased hunting pressure and shifts in trading patterns leading to enhanced trading of endangered species.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disease transmission between wildlife and domestic animals impacting local incomes and livelihoods.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sudden and sustained decline in tourist numbers impacting local revenue and livelihoods.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of zoonotic diseases from wildlife to domestic animals or human communities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact on livelihoods and food security leading to increased exploitation of wildlife and habitats.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
